column2: Yéni ve '''lintë''' yuldar avánier ('The years have passed like '''swift''' draughts')<ref>{{RGEO

column1: This word is a relic from [[J.R.R. Tolkien
column2: Tolkien]]'s juvenile language called [[Nevbosh]]. In that language ''lint'' means "quick, clever, nimble"<ref>''[[The Monsters and the Critics]]'' p. 205, 206</ref>
